page.title: 18HARDEN AND HAINWORTH MOORS 2
page.content: The lower pastures are divided into irregular fields bounded by dry-stone walls of the locally extracted sandstone. Most of the farms in the area are of comparatively small acreage and concentrate their activities on a mixture of dairy and sheep farming along with the cultivation of grassland for silage and pasture. A number of the farms have diversified to provide facilities such as riding stables and kennelling for pets. The only amenity in the area is "The Guide" public house which is appropriately positioned on a crossroads. The present building dates from 1930 and was built to replace a former inn, "The Awd Gawmless" which stood a few hundred yards away towards Cullingworth.
